intro: Heeria mucronata, commonly known as the narrow-leafed heeria, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and woodland areas. Heeria mucronata is often found as an understorey plant, contributing to the biodiversity of its native habitat.
